name: Accent sweep
description: This algorithm recreates a very specific aspect of the Roland TB-303's circuitry. There is a lengthy write-up on it on the Devil Fish page here (https://www.firstpr.com.au/rwi/dfish/303-unique.html), but essentially it creates an AD (attack/decay) envelope which will reach a higher maximum level if repeatedly triggered.
gui_description: The display shows the input (dark) and output (light) signals.

params.name: Input mode
params.description: Sets how the input is treated: "Direct" feeds the input signal directly into the AD shaper. "Trigger" uses the input to trigger an internal pulse, which is fed into the shaper.

params.name: Trigger length
params.description: If the input mode is "Trigger", the length of the pulse.

params.name: Trigger voltage
params.description: If the input mode is "Trigger", the voltage of the pulse.

params.name: Shape
params.description: This is the position of the pot (potentiometer), if you studied the Devil Fish write-up. At 0% the output is quite close to the input; at 100% it is heavily affected by the AD shaper.

params.name: Gain
params.description: Applies a gain to the output shape.

params.name: Charge
params.description: The value of the charge resistor.

params.name: Discharge
params.description: The value of the discharge resistor.

params.name: Input
params.description: The bus to use as input.

params.name: Output
params.description: The bus to use as output.

params.name: Output mode
params.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.
